citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: United States State Boundaries, 2022

descript.abstract: U.S. State Boundaries represents the boundary lines of the 50 states and the District of Columbia of the United States.
descript.purpose: U.S. State Boundaries provides detailed boundary lines consistent with the state, county, and Census block group and tract datasets, and are effective for cartographic display at regional and state levels. The boundaries are categorized by type.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The spatial accuracy varies with the source materials used. The Census Bureau cannot specify the spatial accuracy of features changed or added by field staff or through local updates, features derived from the GBF/DIME Files (TIGER's predecessor in 1970 and 1980), or other map or digital sources. The positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
citeinfo.title: National Sub-State Geography Geodatabase; Areal Hydrography National Geodatabase, Linear Hydrography National Geodatabase

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: NOAA National Shoreline

pubinfo.publish: National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Started with the Data and Maps 2022 U.S. States and ran the Polygon To Line tool to create the lines feature class. Added the fields TYPE and TYPE_DESC and manually selected each line and calculated their values.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the boundary lines of the states and state equivalents of the United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The code for the type of boundary.
The description for the type of boundary.

edom.edomvd: The description of the type of boundary.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

In the United States, contact the Esri Sales staff at +1-800-447-9778 or visit https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=1 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0.

distinfo.distliab: See access and use constraints information.

digtinfo.formcont: To use this data requires software that works with FGDB files.

stdorder.ordering: Data and Maps is available only as part of ArcGIS software.
